articles.title: Trump says he does not want, nor foresee, war with Iran
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Tuesday he does not want, or foresee, war with Iran, after he earlier threatened to retaliate against the country following violent protests led by Iranian-backed militias at the U.S. embassy in Baghdad.

articles.title: China's central bank says economic growth resilient despite large pressure
articles.description: China's central bank said on Wednesday that economic growth remains resilient despite relatively large downward pressure.
articles.content:
BEIJING, Jan 1 (Reuters) - China’s central bank said on Wednesday that economic growth remains resilient despite relatively large downward pressure.

articles.title: Soccer-Guardiola says Man City was team of the decade
articles.description: Manchester City were the team of the decade in the Premier League because no other club had won more trophies, points or scored more goals over the past 10 years, manager Pep Guardiola said on Tuesday.
articles.content:
Jan 1 (Reuters) - Manchester City were the team of the decade in the Premier League because no other club had won more trophies, points or scored more goals over the past 10 years, manager Pep Guardiola said on Tuesday.

articles.title: Australian bushfires claim third victim as authorities struggle to reach cut-off areas

articles.title: Iran denies role in U.S. embassy violence, warns against retaliation
articles.description: Iran denied it was behind violent protests at the U.S. embassy in Iraq on Tuesday and warned against any retaliation, after President Donald Trump blamed Tehran for an attack on the mission and said it would be held responsible.
articles.content:
DUBAI (Reuters) - Iran denied it was behind violent protests at the U.S. embassy in Iraq on Tuesday and warned against any retaliation, after President Donald Trump blamed Tehran for an attack on the mission and said it would be held responsible.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Protesters burn security post at U.S. Embassy in Iraq in new foreign policy test for Trump
articles.description: The United States is deploying about 750 soldiers to the Middle East in response to the violent protests at the U.S. Embassy in Iraq, Defense Secretary Mark Esper said on Tuesday. Chris Dignam has more.
articles.content:
Posted 
The United States is deploying about 750 soldiers to the Middle East in response to the violent protests at the U.S. Embassy in Iraq, Defense Secretary Mark Esper said on Tuesday. Chris Dignam has more.
